physical_examinations.relevant_findings: BMI of 47; suffers from hypertension, hyperlipidemia, and impaired fasting glucose.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Initially, Ms. W had a BMI of 47 before surgery, which improved to a BMI of 32.8 at 12 months post-surgery, with normalization of hypertension, hyperlipidemia, and fasting glucose levels.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Ms. W lost 83 lb and experienced some nausea after eating, which resolved in a few months. Mild dumping symptoms occurred with certain foods.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Weight loss of 83 lb observed by 12 months, but began experiencing urges to overeat and episodes of subjective binge eating.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Continued episodes of subjective binge eating, occurring about once a week.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: She lost an additional 17 lb from the 12-month mark but started to gain some weight thereafter.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Reported difficulty sleeping, tearfulness, and increased urges to eat inappropriately.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Regained 6 lb compared to the previous follow-up; depressive symptoms and difficulties with binge eating re-emerged.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Significant improvements in health and quality of life despite some weight gain.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Although weight increased to 205 lb, she remains significantly below her preoperative weight and reports feeling more comfortable in social situations.
